sections.purpose: To protect laboratory personnel from inhaling hazardous chemical vapors.
sections.scope: Applicable to general laboratory operations in Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Verify the exhaust fan is running by checking the airflow monitor.
Keep the sash at or below the 'Safe Working Level' mark.
Position all equipment at least 6 inches from the front edge of the hood.
Avoid blocking the rear baffles to ensure uniform airflow.
Perform chemical reactions and transfers slowly to minimize turbulence.
Clean the work surface immediately after a spill using appropriate agents.
Lower the sash completely when the hood is not in use.
Document any airflow alarms or equipment malfunctions in the log.
precautions: Do not use the fume hood for long-term storage of chemical waste.
Keep the lab door closed to prevent cross-drafts near the hood.
Wear full PPE, including safety goggles and gloves, while working.
Do not place your head or upper body inside the hood during operation.
Inspect the sash cable and light functionality monthly.
